text: == Events == === By area === ==== Africa ==== * Béjaïa becomes the capital of the Hammadid Dynasty in Algeria. ==== Europe ==== * Third expedition of the Almoravid army in al-Andalus who subdue the taifas kingdoms. Córdoba, Seville, Grenada, Málaga, Almería and Ronda fall to the troops of Yusuf ibn Tashfin.Gilbert Meynier (2010) L'Algérie cœur du Maghreb classique. De l'ouverture islamo-arabe au repli (658-1518). Paris: La Découverte; pp.83. === By topic === ==== Arts and culture ==== * Troubadours begin playing in Provence. ==== Technology ==== * Song Dynasty Chinese writer Qin Guan writes the Can Shu (Book of Sericulture), which describes a silk-reeling machine that has the world's oldest known mechanical belt drive. == Births == * Saint Bernard of Clairvaux (d. 1153) * Eliezer ben Nathan of Mainz * Qin Hui, Chinese Song Dynasty Prime Minister (d. 1155) == Deaths == * June 26 - Jaromír (Bishop of Prague) * July 3 - Egbert II, Margrave of Meissen (b. c. 1060) * October 6 - Saint Adalbero == References ==
